# NSTableView.Style.automatic

**Case**

The system resolves the table view style based on the table view hierarchy.

## Declaration

```swift
case automatic
```

## Discussion

The system resolves the table view style in the following manner:

- If the table view is in a sidebar split-view controller item, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/effectiveStyle] resolves to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/Style-swift.enum/sourceList].
- If the tableâ€™s scroll view has a border, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/effectiveStyle] resolves to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/Style-swift.enum/fullWidth].
- Otherwise, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/effectiveStyle] resolves to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/Style-swift.enum/inset]. However, if the table needs extra space to fit its column cells, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/effectiveStyle] resolves to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/Style-swift.enum/fullWidth].



## Table Styles

- **NSTableView.Style.fullWidth**: The table view style resolves to a full-width style.
- **NSTableView.Style.inset**: The table view style resolves to an inset style.
- **NSTableView.Style.sourceList**: The table view style resolves to a source-list style.
- **NSTableView.Style.plain**: The table view style resolves to a plain style.
